bodyErrorScreen.errorDescription: Please ensure your inputted values are within the accepted range

about.content5-1:
When comparing with your wardrobe items, we recommend to you the closest size based on our Fit Score™ algorithm. If you already love the fit of an item in your wardrobe, it's our mission to find you a new item with that exact same fit. 

 You have full control of the items in your wardrobe so that you can add and delete items that will help with your future size recommendations.
about.content5-2: When comparing with your body information, we recommend you the best size using our personalized fit recommendation engine. We want you to look and feel just as good as the fashion designer intended you to, and to do so our personalization tool translates your predicted body measurements and finds the closest size that we think will look the best on you based on all the information the brand provides us about the item. Virtusize recommendations get more and more accurate as you give us more information about yourself, so please don't be shy in making your profile as complete as possible.
about.title2: Personalization based on your past purchases
about.title3: Personalization based on brands you already love
about.title5: Your Virtusize profile - a one-stop shop to manage your sizing profile
about.content6: In order to personalize a size recommendation specifically for you, we require fairly detailed information about you. We strongly believe in data security and take the management of your personal information seriously - we take significant measures to ensure the safety of your data. For more information, please review our %{linkStart}privacy policy here%{linkEnd}
about.content4: Whether you're exploring a new brand you've never worn, or considering branching out into a new style a bit out of your comfort zone - maybe something oversized, or a bit tighter than you'd usually wear - our personalized fit recommendation engine finds you the best size for your body in just a few steps.
about.content3: Virtusize has a personalized brand sizing engine, which recommends a size based on a brand that you already love to wear. After creating a new virtual item from a brand and size you wear, we store this information in your wardrobe to allow you to reference it at any time later on in your shopping journey. When you're having trouble figuring out how this brand sizes compared to one of your favorites or are "pretty sure about what size to buy" and just need that extra layer of assurance, this is the option for you.
about.content2: The most reliable way to recommend a size to you is by using purchase history. A size recommendation based on a previous purchase that you know and love is the surefire accurate way to find your next perfect fit and is highly recommended for those who believe every centimeter counts.
about.content1: The value in our personalization tools is that it's all about you - not only what others have liked or bought, not just based on a standardized brand that fits you well - Virtusize's personalization engine becomes tailored to you based on what you've actually purchased before, based on a wardrobe full of items from thousands of brands you know and love, and your up-to-date body profile.

faq.content3-3: Similarly if your reference dress fits perfectly, you know that any dress you buy in the future should have the same measurements.
faq.content9: Don't worry. Your Virtusize account is completely private. We won't post anything to Facebook.
faq.title8: Are the garments I buy guaranteed to have the exact dimensions shown online?
faq.title9: If I use Virtusize, will you post anything on my Facebook Timeline or newsfeed?
faq.title10: Why can't I use Virtusize on all of the garments I'm interested in?
faq.content10: Each retailer decides which garments will offer Virtusize, and sometimes it takes a while to accurately measure each new item in the catalog.
faq.heading: FAQ
faq.content11:
With the latest version of Virtusize, you can delete your Virtusize account by yourself.
1. Open menu by pressing the hamburger menu icon located on the top right corner.
2. Go to your account page by pressing Account in the menu.
3. Press the Delete button in Delete Account.
If you are having trouble deleting your Virtusize account, please contact us at %{email}.
faq.title2: Why are items automatically added to my wardrobe?
faq.title3: How do I know which size to choose?
faq.title4: Does a difference of one centimeter mean that the garment won't fit me?
faq.title11: How do I delete my Virtusize account?
faq.title5: How does Virtusize handle different fabric types and stretch fabrics?
faq.title6: Why does my garment look so strange?
faq.title7: Why does my garment look so large/small?
faq.content8: While Virtusize is extremely accurate, we unfortunately cannot guarantee measurements because there's always some degree of deviation in garment production.
faq.content7: Unexpected size variations can result from comparisons of garments that are made of different fabric types. For instance, if one garment is made with stretch fabric and the other isn't, they'll look very different next to each other. Remember to use a reference item made with fabric as similar as possible to the garment you're comparing it to.
faq.content6: If your garment looks strange, you may have entered an incorrect measurement somewhere. Make sure you measured your garment flat. Also, double-check that sleeve measurements start from the back of the collar.
faq.content5: Virtusize doesn't differentiate between fabric types, yet. So please check the label of your reference garment to make sure both items are composed of similar types of fabric.
faq.content4: Probably not. In most cases, one inch is insignificant. But some measurements are more sensitive than others. For example, a difference of one inch on a sleeve or an inseam would probably affect the fit, while elsewhere it wouldn't be noticeable. So here's a tip. If you think that a garment you want to buy is borderline too big or too small, try comparing it against the largest or smallest item you own that fits well.
faq.content2: When you shop from online retailers that have enabled Virtusize, the items you buy are automatically added to your wardrobe. This is to help you compare items from different stores. For integrity reasons, these items cannot be edited or removed as long as you are signed out.By signing up for a Virtusize account, you get your own wardrobe, where any item you buy is stored. You can access it from any computer, and you can add, edit and remove items as you wish.
faq.content1-1: For optimal results, always try to compare items with similar cut, fabric and style. For increased accuracy you can add more than one reference garment.
faq.content1-2: When you buy an item that has Virtusize, don't forget to save it in your Virtusize wardrobe for future reference.
faq.content1-3: Even if it doesn't fit, you can use it to see how an item is not supposed to fit.
faq.content3-1: Virtusize lets you choose the perfect size by using your own reference items as a guide.
faq.content3-2: Once you've added reference items to your Virtusize profile, you can compare those to any items you're thinking of buying to see how they fit. For instance, if your reference top fits slightly tight, you can choose a new top that is a little bit larger.

slide1.title: 服装のチェック
slide1.text:
正しく採寸するため、ハイヒール、帽子、ルーズな服、上着などは身に付けないでください。
また、靴を脱ぎ、袖をまくり、シャツなどをズボンに入れてください。

slide2.title: 場所・背景のチェック
slide2.text: 暗所・逆光、また他の人物が入り込む場所を避け、あなたの服の色がはっきり見える背景を選んでください。

slide3.title: 全身を枠に合わせて撮影
slide3.text: 音声ガイドを聞きながら、全身を白い点線枠内に合わせて撮影してください。

slide4.title: さあ、試してみましょう
slide4.text: 準備ができたら「はじめる」をタップしてください。撮影した画像からあなただけのシルエットが自動で作成されます。

slide0.title: スマートフォンの設置
slide0.text: スマートフォンをお腹の高さくらいに設置し、水平・垂直に固定します。

slide1.title: 服装のチェック

slide3.title: 全身を枠に合わせて撮影
slide3.text:
撮影する人のアドバイスをもらいながら、全身を白い点線の枠内に合わせて撮影します。
枠内におさまるまで何回か撮影してください。

slide4.title: さあ、試してみましょう
slide4.text: 準備ができたら「はじめる」をタップしてください。撮影した画像からあなただけのシルエットが自動で作成されます。

slide0.title: スマートフォンの固定

This recommendation is on the big size 
 so that there’s room to grow.

This recommendation is based on what 
 many of other shoppers have bought for 
 kids with similar profiles. We tend to 
 recommend on the bigger side so that 
 there is room to grow.
